Linux kernel source tree

This repository contains the source code for the Linux kernel, which is the kernel used by the GNU/Linux operating system.

About

The Linux kernel is a free and open-source, monolithic, modular, multitasking, Unix-like operating system kernel. It was conceived and created in 1991 by Linus Torvalds for his i386-based PC, and it was soon adopted as the kernel for the GNU operating system, which was created as free software and developed under the GNU Project.

Linux is deployed on a wide variety of computing systems, such as embedded devices, personal computers, servers, mainframes, and supercomputers.

Building

To build the kernel, you will need the GCC compiler, make, and other build tools. See the documentation in the Documentation/ directory for more information.

Contributing

Patches should be submitted to the mailing list. See Documentation/process/submitting-patches.rst for details.
